Conclusion

\w Î›Î¿Î¹Ï€ÏŒÎ½|strong="G3063"\w*, \w á¼€Î´ÎµÎ»Ï†Î¿Î¯|strong="G0080"\w*, \w Ï‡Î±Î¯ÏÎµÏ„Îµ|strong="G5463"\w*Â· \w ÎºÎ±Ï„Î±ÏÏ„Î¯Î¶ÎµÏƒÎ¸Îµ|strong="G2675"\w*Â· \w Ï€Î±ÏÎ±ÎºÎ±Î»Îµá¿–ÏƒÎ¸Îµ|strong="G3870"\w*Â· \w Ï„á½¸|strong="G3588"\w* \w Î±á½Ï„á½¸|strong="G0846"\w* \w Ï†ÏÎ¿Î½Îµá¿–Ï„Îµ|strong="G5426"\w*Â· \w Îµá¼°ÏÎ·Î½ÎµÏÎµÏ„Îµ|strong="G1514"\w*Â· \w ÎºÎ±á½¶|strong="G2532"\w* \w á½|strong="G3588"\w* \w Î˜Îµá½¸Ï‚|strong="G2316"\w* \w Ï„á¿†Ï‚|strong="G3588"\w* \w á¼€Î³Î¬Ï€Î·Ï‚|strong="G0026"\w* \w ÎºÎ±á½¶|strong="G2532"\w* \w Ï„á¿†Ï‚|strong="G3588"\w*\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Ï„Î·Ï‚ \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* [30%] CP Â¦ â€” ğ•»\+sup 46\+sup*â„µA,B [70%] RP,HF,OC,TR,NU\f* \w Îµá¼°ÏÎ®Î½Î·Ï‚|strong="G1515"\w* \w á¼”ÏƒÏ„Î±Î¹|strong="G1510"\w* \w Î¼ÎµÎ¸|strong="G3326"\w*á¾¿ \w á½‘Î¼á¿¶Î½|strong="G4771"\w*.

\w á¼ˆÏƒÏ€Î¬ÏƒÎ±ÏƒÎ¸Îµ|strong="G0782"\w* \w á¼€Î»Î»Î®Î»Î¿Ï…Ï‚|strong="G0240"\w* \w á¼Î½|strong="G1722"\w* \w á¼Î³Î¯á¿³|strong="G0040"\w* \w Ï†Î¹Î»Î®Î¼Î±Ï„Î¹|strong="G5370"\w*.\f + \fr 13:12 \ft Î±Î³Î¹Ï‰ Ï†Î¹Î»Î·Î¼Î±Ï„Î¹ \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* â„µB [80%] RP,HF,OC,TR,NU Â¦ ~ 21 ğ•»\+sup 46\+sup*A [20%] CP\f*

\w á¼©|strong="G3588"\w* \w Ï‡Î¬ÏÎ¹Ï‚|strong="G5485"\w* \w Ï„Î¿á¿¦|strong="G3588"\w* \w ÎšÏ…ÏÎ¯Î¿Ï…|strong="G2962"\w* \w á¼¡Î¼á¿¶Î½|strong="G1473"\w*\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Î·Î¼Ï‰Î½ \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* [40%] Â¦ â€” ğ•»\+sup 46\+sup*â„µA,B [60%] RP,HF,OC,TR,CP,NU\f* \w á¼¸Î·ÏƒÎ¿á¿¦|strong="G2424"\w* \w Î§ÏÎ¹ÏƒÏ„Î¿á¿¦|strong="G5547"\w*, \w ÎºÎ±á½¶|strong="G2532"\w* \w á¼¡|strong="G3588"\w* \w á¼€Î³Î¬Ï€Î·|strong="G0026"\w* \w Ï„Î¿á¿¦|strong="G3588"\w* \w Î˜ÎµÎ¿á¿¦|strong="G2316"\w*, \w ÎºÎ±á½¶|strong="G2532"\w* \w á¼¡|strong="G3588"\w* \w ÎºÎ¿Î¹Î½Ï‰Î½Î¯Î±|strong="G2842"\w* \w Ï„Î¿á¿¦|strong="G3588"\w* \w á¼‰Î³Î¯Î¿Ï…|strong="G0040"\w* \w Î Î½ÎµÏÎ¼Î±Ï„Î¿Ï‚|strong="G4151"\w* \w Î¼ÎµÏ„á½°|strong="G3326"\w* \w Ï€Î¬Î½Ï„Ï‰Î½|strong="G3956"\w* \w á½‘Î¼á¿¶Î½|strong="G4771"\w*. \w á¼ˆÎ¼Î®Î½|strong="G0281"\w*.\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Î±Î¼Î·Î½ \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* [92%] RP,HF,OC,TR,CP Â¦ â€” ğ•»\+sup 46\+sup*â„µA,B [8%] NU\f*\sup ,\sup*\f + \fr 13:14 \ft The citation of \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* is based on the following thirty-six MSSâ€”18, 35, 141, 201, 204, 328, 386, 432, 444, 757, 824, 928, 986, 1072, 1075, 1100, 1249, 1482, 1503, 1548, 1617, 1637, 1652, 1725, 1740, 1855, 1864, 1865, 1892, 1897, 2352, 2431, 2466, 2554, 2587 and 2723â€”all of which I collated myself. 2554 is a â€˜perfectâ€™ representative of \+bd f\+bd*\+sup 35\+sup* in 2 Corinthians, as it stands, as were the exemplars of 1865 and 2723. For a book this size the uniformity is impressive. Since these MSS come from all over the Mediterranean world (Sinai, Jerusalem, Aegean, Patmos, Constantinople, Bucharest, Trikala, Meteora, Athens, Mt. Athos [seven different monasteries], Grottaferrata, Vatican, etc.) they are certainly representative of the family, giving us the precise family profileâ€”it is reflected in the Text without exception. In the statements of evidence I have included the percentage of manuscript attestation for each variant within either ( ) or [ ]. I have used ( ) for the evidence taken from \+it TuT\+it*, which I take to be reasonably precise. For the variant sets that are not covered there I used Reuben Swansonâ€™s excellent collations (\+it New Testament Greek Manuscripts: 2 Corinthians\+it* [Ed. Reuben Swanson, Carol Stream, IL: Tyndale House Publishers, 2005]). For 2 Corinthians Swanson collated 83 MSS, five being fragmentary (for any given variant set there will usually be at least 75 MSS listed), and I occasionally supplemented from Scrivener and von Sodenâ€”the percentages offered, I have used [ ] for these, are extrapolations based on a comparison of these sources. I venture to predict, if complete collations ever become available, that for any non-Byzantine variants listed with 5 to 1% support (in my apparatus) the margin of error should not exceed Â±1%; for non-Byzantine variants listed with 10 to 6% support the margin of error should hardly exceed Â±2%; where there is some division among the Byzantine witnesses the margin of error should rarely exceed Â±10%â€”by comparing Swanson with \+it TuT\+it*, I believe one can make a fairly accurate extrapolation. However, I guarantee the witness of Family 35. Please see the last footnote for Matthew for further information.\f*
